orbotix.robot.base
Class TiltDriveAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
  orbotix.robot.base.DriveAlgorithm
      orbotix.robot.base.TiltDriveAlgorithm

public class TiltDriveAlgorithm
extends DriveAlgorithm

Converts accelerometer coordinates into heading and speed values. Angles are calculated from the accelerometer coordinates to get the angle the device is tilted from the device laying flat. The angle from the positive x-axis is used for the heading and the tilt angle is up to the MAXIMUM_TILT angle is used for speed.

The stopPositon values are consider as radians from the device laying flat. The deadZoneDelta values are the delta values in the accelerometer values that are still consider zero.

See Also:
DriveAlgorithm

convert

public void convert(double x,
                    double y,

Description copied from class: DriveAlgorithm
Converts the input coordinates into a heading and speed. Input coordinates are dependent on the method used, for macrolab, they can be accelerometer coordinates or a point in a view.

Specified by:
convert in class DriveAlgorithm
Parameters:
x - First coordinate in the input coordinates.
y - Second coordinate in the input coordinates.
z - Third coordinate in the input coordinates.
